     Question                                                  Answers                                     Notes                    Total
1.     a    i                   3.275 g                                                   Accept other valid methods for M1.
                 n(Ag)  «                       » 0.03036 «mol»
                             107.87 g mol
                 AND                                                                      Award [1 max] for correct empirical
                                                                                          formula if method not shown.
                            3.760 g  3.275 g          0.485
                 n(O)  «                   1
                                                              » 0.03031 «mol» 
                               16.00 gmol              16.00                                                                         2


                     0.03036
                 «             ≈ 1 / ratio of Ag to O approximately 1 : 1, so»
                     0.03031
                 AgO 
1.     a    ii   temperature too low                                                      Accept “not heated strongly enough”.
                 OR
                 heating time too short                                                   If M1 as per markscheme, M2 can only
                 OR                                                                       be awarded for constant mass
                                                                                          technique.
                 oxide not decomposed completely 

                                                                                          Accept "soot deposition" (M1) and any      2
                 heat sample to constant mass «for three or more trials»                 suitable way to reduce it (for M2).
                                                                                          Accept "absorbs moisture from
                                                                                          atmosphere" (M1) and "cool in
                                                                                          dessicator" (M2).
                                                                                          Award [1 max] for reference to impurity
                                                                                          AND design improvement.
1.     b         Ar closer to 107/less than 108 «so more 107Ag»                           Accept calculations that gives greater
                                                                                          than 50% 107Ag.
                 OR                                                                                                                  1
                 Ar less than the average of (107         109) «so more 107Ag» 
                                                                           –4–                                  M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


  Question                                       Answers                                                    Notes                          Total
1   c    i         Flask        Colour of solution     Product formula                      Do not accept name for the products.
                containing                                                                  Accept “Na  OH” for NaOH.

               Na2O                   blue                       NaOH                                                                      3
                                                                                            Ignore coefficients in front of formula.
                                      AND
               P4O10                 yellow                     H3PO4 

1.   c   ii   «molten» Na2O has mobile ions/charged particles AND conducts electricity    Do not award marks without concept of
              «molten» P4O10 does not have mobile ions/charged particles AND does not       mobile charges being present.
              conduct electricity/is poor conductor of electricity                         Award [1 max] if type of bonding or
                                                                                            electrical conductivity correctly identified
                                                                                            in each compound.
                                                                                                                                            2
                                                                                            Do not accept answers based on
                                                                                            electrons.
                                                                                            Award [1 max] if reference made to
                                                                                            solution.
1.   d        electrons in discrete/specific/certain/different shells/energy levels        Accept appropriate diagram for M1, M2
              energy levels converge/get closer together at higher energies                 or both.

              OR                                                                                                                            2
                                                                                            Do not give marks for answers that refer
              energy levels converge with distance from the nucleus                        to the lines in the spectrum.
                                                                                  –5–                               M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                           Answers                                                   Notes                 Total
2.     a    i     Sn2(aq)      Sn4(aq)  2e                                               Accept equilibrium sign.
                                                                                                                                          1
                                                                                                 Accept Sn2(aq)  2e  Sn4(aq).
2.     a    ii    Cr2O72(aq)  14H(aq)  3Sn2(aq)  2Cr3(aq)  7H2O(l)  3Sn4(aq)    Accept equilibrium sign.                 1
2.     b    i     «13.239 g  0.002 g so percentage uncertainty» 0.02 «%»                       Accept answers given to greater
                                                                                                                                          1
                                                                                                 precision, such as 0.0151 %.
2.     b    ii                               13.239 g
                  « [K2Cr2O7]                                     » 0.450 «mol dm3»                                                   1
                                    294.20 g mol  0.100 dm
                                                –1             3



2.     b    iii                                                     3 mol                        Award [2] for correct final answer.
                  n(Sn2)  «0.450 mol dm3  0.01324 dm3                  » 0.0179 «mol» 
                                                                    1 mol
                                                                                                                                          2
                                0.0179mol
                  «[Sn2]                   » 1.79 «mol dm
                                                           3»
                                                                   
                                0.0100 dm3
                                                                       –6–                                       M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

     Question                                      Answers                                                      Notes                     Total
3.     a    i
                 « Kc » 
                            PCl3 Cl2 
                                            
                              PCl 5
                                                                                                                                           1

3.     a    ii   decrease in temperature                                                     Do not accept “temperature change”.

                 endothermic «reaction» AND «equilibrium» shifts to the left/reactants
                                                                                               Accept “∆H positive” in place of
                 OR                                                                            “endothermic”.
                 endothermic «reaction» AND Kc decreases                                                                                   2
                 OR
                 endothermic «reaction» AND concentration of PCl5 increased/concentration of
                 PCl3 and Cl2 decreased
                 OR                                                                            Accept “products” instead of “PCl3 and
                 «equilibrium» shifts in exothermic direction                                 Cl2”.
3.      b        Lewis structure:                                                              Penalize missing lone pairs once only
                                                                                               between this question and 4(b).
                                                                                               Accept any combination of lines, dots or
                                                                                               crosses to represent electrons.
                                                                                                                                          2


                 Molecular geometry:
                 trigonal/triangular pyramidal                                                Do not apply ECF.
                                                                         –7–                                    M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

     Question                                         Answers                                                 Notes                      Total
4.     a    i     triple bond in nitrogen «molecule» AND single bond in hydrazine            Accept bond enthalpy values from data
                                                                                              booklet (158 and 945 kJ mol1).
                  triple bond stronger than single bond
                  OR                                                                                                                      2
                  more shared «pairs of» electrons make bond stronger/attract nuclei more 

4.     a    ii    hydrogen bonding «between molecules, dinitrogen tetraoxide does not» 
                                                                                                                                          1

4.     a    iii   N2H4: 2 AND N2O4: 4 
                                                                                                                                          1
4.     a    iv    N2H4 AND oxidized/oxidation state increases                                 Accept “N2H4 AND gives electrons «to
                  OR                                                                          N2O4»”.

                  N2H4 AND loses hydrogen                                                                                                 1
                  OR
                  N2H4 AND reduces/removes oxygen from N2O4 
4.     b                                                                                      Accept any combination of lines, dots or
                                                                                              crosses to represent electrons.
                                                                                              Do not penalize missing lone pairs if
                                                                                              already done in 3b.                         2

                                                                                              Do not accept structure that represents
                                                                                             1.5 bonds.
                                                                       –8–                                       M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

     Question                                         Answers                                                    Notes                  Total
5.     a    i    concentration of acid decreases                                              Accept “less frequency/chance/rate/
                 OR                                                                           probability/likelihood of collisions”.

                 surface area of magnesium decreases                                         Do not accept just “less acid” or “less
                                                                                              magnesium”.                                1
                                                                                              Do not accept “concentrations of
                                                                                              reagents decrease”.
5.     a    ii




                                                                                                                                         1




                 curve starting from origin with steeper gradient AND reaching same maximum
                 volume 
5.     b         «Ea(rev)  226  132 » 358 «kJ»                                            Do not accept 358.                        1
5.     c         2NO2(g)  H2O(l)  HNO3(aq)  HNO2(aq)                                   Accept ionised forms of the acids.
                 OR                                                                                                                      1
                 4NO2(g)  2H2O(l)  O2(g)  4HNO3(aq) 
                                                            –9–                     M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

     Question                                     Answers                            Notes                  Total
6.     a        Initiation:                                       Do not penalize missing electron dot on
                                                                  radicals if consistent throughout.
                Cl –Cl  Cl  Cl  
                                                                  Accept Cl2, HCl and CH3Cl without
                                                                 showing bonds.
                Propagation:                                      Do not accept hydrogen radical, H• or      3
                Cl  CH4  Cl –H  CH3                        H, but apply ECF to other propagation
                                                                  steps.
                Cl –Cl  CH3  Cl –CH3  Cl 

6.     b        hexane AND hex-1-ene                             Accept “benzene AND hexane AND
                                                                  hex-1-ene”.                                1

6.     c                                                          Accept “CH2CHCl” or “CHClCH2”.
                OR                                                Do not accept “C2H3Cl”.

                                                                                                             1


                                

   Question                                         Answers                                Notes                 Total
7.   a    i     water/H2O                                                 Accept “hydroxide ion/OH-”.             1
7.   a    ii              Acid               Base
                 HOCl           AND    OCl
                                                                                                                   1
                 OR
                 H2O            AND    OH
7.   b    i     «0.100 mol dm3  0.0250 dm3»  0.00250 «mol»                                                     1
7.   b    ii              0.510 g
                «M                  » 204 «g mol1»                                                             1
                        0.00250mol
7.   b    iii   «1.00  1014  [H]  0.100»
                                                                                                                   1
                1.00  1013 «mol dm3» 
                                                                         – 11 –                      M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M

     Question                                        Answers                                       Notes                    Total
8.     a    i                   189.2                                             Accept other methods for correct
                 H  177.0             285.5 «kJ»                            manipulation of the three equations.
                                  2
                                                                                  Award [2] for correct final answer.
                 «H »  203.1 «kJ»                                                                                        2



8.     a    ii   203.1 «kJ»  0.850 «kg»  4.18 «kJ kg1 K1»  T «K»            Award [2] for correct final answer.
                 OR
                 «T » 57.2 «K»                                                Units, if specified, must be consistent
                                                                                  with the value stated.
                 «Tfinal  (57.2  21.8) C » 79.0«C» / 352.0 «K» 
                 
                                                                                                                             2
                 If 200.0 kJ was used:
                 200.0 «kJ»  0.850 «kg»  4.18 «kJ kg1 K1»  T «K»
                 OR
                 «T » 56.3 «K» 
                 «Tfinal  (56.3  21.8) C » 78.1 «C» / 351.1 «K» 
8.     b         C6H4(OH)2                                                      Accept “molecular ion”.
                                                                                  Do not accept “C6H4(OH)2” (positive        1
                                                                                  charge missing).
8.     c         «highest m/z» 108                                               Only accept exactly 108, not values
                                                                                  close to this.                             1
